text: Back in the days when I was a rookie in the police force, the Chief was a veteran. He had caught a notorious criminal – or had been awarded for bravery. But he had – a young daughter.
keypoint: Veteran Chief introduced, along with his young daughter

text: And in those days I was a fitness enthusiast. And it seemed she was trying to impress me. I never observed it.
keypoint: Fitness-minded rookie unwittingly attracts daughter's attention

text: Truth is I wasn't very fond of her because she was – She was a charming girl until she opened her mouth. She was a chatterbox. Goodness, she could talk.
keypoint: Narrator annoyed by girl's constant chatter

text: Then she left a message one day saying she was going to run away because he was always scolding her about me. He arrived at my apartment. Big intimidating look on his face.
keypoint: Daughter's runaway message brings furious Chief to narrator

text: I managed to calm him down. and proposed “Well we'll search for her and if we can't locate her well you can – do whatever you think is right.” I was strategizing.
keypoint: Narrator calms Chief and proposes organized search

text: So he accepted my offer. And we went to where they found her scarf – near a park. and we traced down a little more and we couldn't locate her.
keypoint: They search the park but cannot find her

text: And returned – it was a police station – she was sitting on a chair with a book in her hands.
keypoint: Returning to station, they find her reading calmly

text: She hadn't run away. But – nevertheless – that resolved the issue for that day.
keypoint: She never ran away; situation temporarily resolved

text: But that evening the deputy, Frank Mitchell, said “You better transfer and leave because that old man never forgets anything once he gets it into his mind.” And I did. I transferred. and left.
keypoint: Deputy warns; narrator transfers to avoid Chief's wrath

text: That was the end of my rookie year.
keypoint: End of narrator's rookie police year
